title: 105_hr3497
content: The "Individual Investment Account Act of 1998" establishes Individual Investment Accounts under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Individual Investment Account Act of 1998 allows individuals to deduct cash payments made to an individual investment account established for their benefit. An individual investment account is a trust created in the U.S. for the exclusive benefit of an individual, meeting specific requirements. The Individual Investment Account Act of 1998 defines an individual investment account as a trust created in the U.S. for the exclusive benefit of an individual, with specific requirements for the governing instrument. The requirements for an individual investment account trust include: contributions must be in cash, trustee must be a bank or approved person, no investment in collectibles, and assets cannot be invested in collectibles. The trust administrator must comply with specified requirements, including no investment in collectibles and no commingling of assets with other property, except in a common trust or investment fund. Contributions are deemed made on the last day of the taxable year if made on account of that year and by the prescribed time. A taxpayer is deemed to have made a contribution on the last day of a taxable year if it is made on account of that year and by the prescribed time for filing the return. Distributions from an individual investment account are generally included in gross income. Any distribution from an individual investment account is typically taxable unless it qualifies as a first-time homebuyer distribution. A qualified 1st-time homebuyer distribution is a payment or distribution received by an individual who is a 1st-time homebuyer from an individual investment account, used within 120 days for qualified acquisition costs. A qualified 1st-time homebuyer distribution is a payment received by a 1st-time homebuyer from an individual investment account, used within 120 days for qualified acquisition costs, with a maximum limit of $20,000 for all taxable years.
